description: Identity and access management for the cloud using Azure Active Directory REST API services.
name: azure-active-directory
label: Azure Active Directory

fields.title: Access Token Type
options: On behalf of User - Delegate Permission
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Select the method using which you will get authentication tokens used to access the security graph APIs. You can choose between On behalf of User – Delegate Permission or Without a User - Application Permission.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Server URL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: resource
Without a User - Application Permission.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique Application ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Client Secret
Without a User - Application Permission.name: client_secret
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Unique Client Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see 'https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp'.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Tenant ID
Without a User - Application Permission.name: tenant_id
Without a User - Application Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

Without a User - Application Permission.title: Verify SSL
Without a User - Application Permission.name: verify_ssl
Without a User - Application Permission.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Server URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: resource
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: The service-based URI to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_id
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Unique API ID of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Client Secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: client_secret
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Unique API Secret of the Azure Active Directory application that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information on how to get the secret key, see 'https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/microsoft-defender-atp/exposed-apis-create-app-webapp'.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Tenant ID
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: tenant_id
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: ID of the tenant that you have been provided for your Azure Active Directory instance.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Authorization Code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: code
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: Authorization code that you acquired in the authorization step.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see the Getting Access Tokens using the Delegate Permissions method section.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Redirect URL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: redirect_url
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.tooltip: (Only Applicable to On behalf of User – Delegate Permission) The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. The redirect URL that you specify here must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you have registered in your app registration portal.

On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.title: Verify SSL
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.name: verify_ssl
On behalf of User - Delegate Permission.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get User Membership
operations.description: Retrieves groups, directory roles, and administrative units of which the user is a direct member.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: User ID or principal name
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user whose group memberships to fetch.

parameters.title: Membership Type
parameters.name: membership_type
parameters.tooltip: Type of group membership to retrieve: direct or transitive
parameters.description: Select the type of group membership to retrieve from following options: direct or transitive

operations.title: Get People
operations.description: Retrieves a collection of person objects in order of their relevance to the user, determined by the user's communication, collaboration patterns, and business relationships.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: User ID or principal name
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user for which to fetch the people records.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which to retrieve people. Refer to Azure Filter Query Parameters for information on the filter query syntax.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on which you want to retrieve records as documented at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/filter-query-parameter

parameters.title: Select Query
parameters.description: Specify the $select query to retrieve people from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as id, displayName, etc. Refer to OData system query options for more information.
parameters.name: $select
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response. For optimal performance, only select the subset of properties needed.

parameters.title: Number Of Records To Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return from Azure.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the count of the first few records to skip while retrieving response from Azure Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Skip the first n results, useful for paging.

operations.title: Get Managers
operations.description: Retrieves the chain of managers for a specified user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: User ID or principal name
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user for whom to fetch the managers list.

operations.title: Revoke SignIn Sessions
operations.description: Invalidates all the refresh tokens issued to applications for a user. Action typically performed if the user's device is lost or stolen.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: User ID or principal name
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user for whom to revoke all sign in sessions.

operations.title: List Direct Reports
operations.description: Retrieves the direct reports for the specified user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: User ID or principal name
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user for whom to fetch the direct reports.

operations.title: List Devices
operations.description: Retrieves a list of device objects registered in the organization.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which to retrieve the list of devices. Refer to Azure Filter Query Parameters for information on the filter query syntax.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on which you want to retrieve records as documented at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/filter-query-parameter

parameters.title: Select Query
parameters.description: Specify the $select query to retrieve people from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as id, displayName, etc. Refer to OData system query options for more information.
parameters.name: $select
parameters.tooltip: Specify the select query to retrieve records from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as: "id", "displayName", etc.

parameters.title: Number Of Records To Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of records that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Get All Pages
parameters.name: get_all_pages
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to fetch all pages containing all available records from Azure.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: List Registered Owners
operations.description: Retrieves a list of users registered as owners of a device.

parameters.title: Device ID
parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Specify the device ID for which to fetch registered owners.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device ID for which to fetch registered owners

operations.title: List Registered Users
operations.description: Retrieves a list of registered users of a device.

parameters.title: Device ID
parameters.name: device_id
parameters.description: Specify the device ID for which to fetch registered owners.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device ID for which to fetch registered owners

operations.title: List User Owned Devices
operations.description: Lists the devices that are owned by a user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user you want to fetch owned devices for
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user you want to fetch owned devices for

operations.title: List User Owned Objects
operations.description: Get the list of directory objects that are owned by a user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: user_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user you want to fetch directory objects for
parameters.description: Specify the user ID or the principal name of the user you want to fetch directory objects for

operations.title: List Groups
operations.description: Retrieves a list of groups from Azure Active Directory based on the query for filtering groups that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which you want to retrieve groups. Refer to Azure Filter Query Parameters for information on the filter query syntax.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on which you want to retrieve groups as documented at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/filter-query-parameter

parameters.title: Select Query
parameters.description: Specify the $select query to retrieve groups from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as id, displayName, etc. Refer to OData system query options for more information.
parameters.name: $select
parameters.tooltip: Specify the select query to retrieve groups from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as: "id", "displayName", etc.

parameters.title: Number Of Groups To Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of groups that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Get All Pages
parameters.name: get_all_pages
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to fetch all pages containing all available records from Azure.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: List Group Members
operations.description: Retrieves a list of members of a particular group from Azure Active Directory based on the query for filtering group members that you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: ID of the group for which you want to list the members
parameters.description: Specify an ID of the group for which you want to list the members.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which you want to retrieve group members. Refer to Azure Filter Query Parameters for information on the filter query syntax.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on you want to retrieve group members as documented at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/filter-query-parameter

parameters.title: Select Query
parameters.description: Specify the $select query to retrieve group members from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as id, userPrincipalName, displayName, etc.
parameters.name: $select
parameters.tooltip: Specify the select query to retrieve group members from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as: "id", "userPrincipalName", "displayName", etc. Allowed properties: businessPhones,displayName,givenName,jobTitle,mail,mobilePhone,officeLocation,preferredLanguage,surname,userPrincipalName,accountEnabled,ageGroup,assignedLicenses,assignedPlans,city,companyName,consentProvidedForMinor,country,createdDateTime,creationType,deletedDateTime,department,employeeHireDate,employeeId,employeeOrgData,employeeType,externalUserState,externalUserStateChangeDateTime,faxNumber,id,identities,imAddresses,isResourceAccount,lastPasswordChangeDateTime,legalAgeGroupClassification,licenseAssignmentStates,mailNickname,onPremisesDistinguishedName,onPremisesDomainName,onPremisesExtensionAttributes,onPremisesImmutableId,onPremisesLastSyncDateTime,onPremisesProvisioningErrors,onPremisesSamAccountName,onPremisesSecurityIdentifier,onPremisesSyncEnabled,onPremisesUserPrincipalName,otherMails,passwordPolicies,passwordProfile,postalCode,preferredDataLocation,provisionedPlans,proxyAddresses,refreshTokensValidFromDateTime,securityIdentifier,showInAddressList,signInSessionsValidFromDateTime,state,streetAddress,usageLocation

parameters.title: Number Of Group Members To Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of group members that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Get All Pages
parameters.name: get_all_pages
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to fetch all pages containing all available records from Azure.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get Group Details
operations.description: Retrieves the details of a particular group from Azure Active Directory based on the group ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Group ID to fetch the details of the group
parameters.description: Specify a group ID to fetch the details for that group.

operations.title: Remove Member
operations.description: Removes a member from a group based on the group and user ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: ID to of the group from which you want to remove the user
parameters.description: Specify a group ID from which you want to remove the user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: dir_object_id
parameters.tooltip: Directory Object ID of the user to remove from the group.
parameters.description: Specify the directory object ID of the user to remove from the group.

operations.title: Add Member
operations.description: Adds a member to a group based on the group and user ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Group ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: ID to of the group to which you want to add a user
parameters.description: Specify a group ID to which you want to add a user.

parameters.title: User ID
parameters.name: dir_object_id
parameters.tooltip: Directory Object ID of the user you want to add to the group.
parameters.description: Specify the directory object ID of the user to add to the group.

operations.title: List SignIns Events
operations.description: Retrieves the list of sign-in events from Azure Active Directory based on the query for filtering users that you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which you want to retrieve sign-in events from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Filter query is supported on the following fields: id, userPrincipalName, displayName, givenName and jobTitle. For example [userPrincipalName eq 'username@example.com'] retrieves a user whose userPrincipalName is username@example.com. Refer to OData system query options for more information.
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on which you want to retrieve sign-in events from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Filter query is supported on the following fields: "id", "userPrincipalName", "displayName", "givenName" and "jobTitle". For example [userPrincipalName eq 'username@fortisoar1.onmicrosoft.com'] retrieve a user which userPrincipalName is username@fortisoar1.onmicrosoft.com

parameters.title: Number of Events to Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of events that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Get All Pages
parameters.name: get_all_pages
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to fetch all pages containing all available records from Azure.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify a Skiptoken if a previous operation returned a partial result. If the previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element includes a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: List Users
operations.description: Retrieves a list of users from Azure Active Directory based on the query for filtering users you have specified.

parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.description: Specify the filter query based on which you want to retrieve users from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Filter query is supported on the following fields: id, userPrincipalName, displayName, givenName and jobTitle. For example [userPrincipalName eq "username@example.com"] retrieves a user whose userPrincipalName is username@example.com
parameters.name: $filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter query based on which you want to retrieve users from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Filter query is supported on the following fields: "id", "userPrincipalName", "displayName", "givenName" and "jobTitle". For example [userPrincipalName eq 'username@fortisoar1.onmicrosoft.com'] retrieve a user which userPrincipalName is username@fortisoar1.onmicrosoft.com

parameters.title: Select Query
parameters.description: Specify the $select query to retrieve user fields from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as id, userPrincipalName, displayName, etc. Refer to OData system query options for more information.
parameters.name: $select
parameters.tooltip: Specify the select query to retrieve user fields from Azure Active Directory. The OData's Select query is supported on fields such as: "id", "userPrincipalName", "displayName", etc.

parameters.title: Number Of Users To Fetch
parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of users that this operation should return from Azure.

parameters.title: Get All Pages
parameters.name: get_all_pages
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.
parameters.description: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, all pages will be fetched from azure so the action will return all available records.

parameters.title: Skip Token
parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: (Optional) Skiptoken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skiptoken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

operations.title: Get User Details
operations.description: Retrieves specific information for a specific user from Azure Active Directory, based on the Object ID or User Principal Name you have specified.

parameters.title: Based On
parameters.name: based_on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter based on which you want to retrieve details of a user from Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.
parameters.description: Select the parameter based on which you want to retrieve details of a user from Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.

Object ID.title: Object ID
Object ID.name: id
Object ID.tooltip: If you choose Object ID, then in the Object ID field, you must specify the ID of the object based on which details of the user are retrieved from Azure Active Directory.
Object ID.description: Specify the object ID of the user whose details are to be retrieved from Azure Active Directory.

User Principal Name.title: User Principal Name
User Principal Name.name: id
User Principal Name.tooltip: If you choose User Principal Name, then in the User Principal Name field, you must specify the principal name of the user whose details you want to retrieve from Azure Active Directory.
User Principal Name.description: Specify the principal name of the user whose details are to be retrieved from Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Provide Additional Details
parameters.name: additional_info
parameters.tooltip: Specifies whether to fetch additional details (aboutMe,birthday,hireDate,interests,mySite,pastProjects,preferredName,responsibilities,schools,skills) of the user. By default, this option is set as True.
parameters.description: Specifies whether to fetch additional details (aboutMe,birthday,hireDate,interests,mySite,pastProjects,preferredName,responsibilities,schools,skills) of the user. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Add User
operations.description: Creates a new user in Azure Active Directory, based on the User Principal Name, Display Name, Password, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Display Name
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.tooltip: Name that you want to display in the address book for the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Specify the name that you want to be displayed in the address book for the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Mail Nick Name
parameters.name: mailNickname
parameters.tooltip: Mail alias for the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Specify the mail alias for the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: User Principal Name
parameters.name: userPrincipalName
parameters.description: Specify the principal name of the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.
parameters.tooltip: Principal name of the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Password
parameters.name: password
parameters.tooltip: Password of the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Specify the password of the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Force Change Password Next Login
parameters.name: force_change
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, then the user is forced to change his password when the users next logs into Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to force the users to change their password when they next log on to Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Account Enabled
parameters.name: accountEnabled
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, then the user's account is enabled on Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to enable this user's account on Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Additional fields that you want to add to the user that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify additional fields to add to the user's account that you are creating in Azure Active Directory.

operations.title: Enable User
operations.description: Enables a specific user's account in Azure Active Directory, based on the Object ID or User Principal Name you have specified.

parameters.title: Based On
parameters.name: based_on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter based on which you want to enable a user's account on Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.
parameters.description: Select the parameter based on which you want to enable a user's account on Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.

Object ID.title: Object ID
Object ID.name: id
Object ID.tooltip: If you choose Object ID, then in the Object ID field, you must specify the ID of the object based on which user account is enabled on Azure Active Directory.
Object ID.description: Specify the object ID associated with the user account to be enabled on Azure Active Directory.

User Principal Name.title: User Principal Name
User Principal Name.name: id
User Principal Name.tooltip: If you choose User Principal Name, then in the User Principal Name field, you must specify the principal name of the user based on which user account is enabled on Azure Active Directory.
User Principal Name.description: Specify the principal name associated with the user account to be enabled on Azure Active Directory.

operations.title: Disable User
operations.description: Disables a specific user's account in Azure Active Directory, based on the Object ID or User Principal Name you have specified.

parameters.title: Based On
parameters.name: based_on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter based on which you want to disable a user's account on Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.
parameters.description: Select the parameter based on which you want to disable a user's account on Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.

Object ID.title: Object ID
Object ID.name: id
Object ID.tooltip: If you choose Object ID, then in the Object ID field, you must specify the ID of the object based on which user account is disabled on Azure Active Directory.
Object ID.description: Specify the object ID associated with the user account to be disabled on Azure Active Directory.

User Principal Name.title: User Principal Name
User Principal Name.name: id
User Principal Name.tooltip: If you choose User Principal Name, then in the User Principal Name field, you must specify the principal name of the user based on which user account is disabled on Azure Active Directory.
User Principal Name.description: Specify the principal name associated with the user account to be disabled on Azure Active Directory.

operations.title: Delete User
operations.description: Deletes a specific user's account from Azure Active Directory, based on the Object ID or User Principal Name you have specified.

parameters.title: Based On
parameters.name: based_on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter based on which you want to delete a user's account from Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.
parameters.description: Select the parameter based on which you want to delete a user's account from Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.

Object ID.title: Object ID
Object ID.name: id
Object ID.tooltip: If you choose Object ID, then in the Object ID field, you must specify the ID of the object based on which user account is deleted from Azure Active Directory.
Object ID.description: Specify the object ID associated with the user account to be deleted on Azure Active Directory.

User Principal Name.title: User Principal Name
User Principal Name.name: id
User Principal Name.tooltip: If you choose User Principal Name, then in the User Principal Name field, you must specify the principal name of the user based on which user account is deleted from Azure Active Directory.
User Principal Name.description: Specify the principal name associated with the user account to be deleted on Azure Active Directory.

operations.title: Reset Password
operations.description: Resets the password for an existing Azure Active Directory user, based on the Object ID or User Principal Name, password, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Based On
parameters.name: based_on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter based on which you want to retrieve details of the user, whose password you want to reset, from Azure Active Directory. You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.
parameters.description: Select the parameter based on which you want to reset the password of a user's account on Azure Active Directory You can choose between Object ID or User Principal Name.

Object ID.title: Object ID
Object ID.name: id
Object ID.tooltip: If you choose Object ID, then in the Object ID field, you must specify the ID of the object based on which details of the user are retrieved from Azure Active Directory.
Object ID.description: Specify the object ID associated with the user account whose password is to be reset on Azure Active Directory.

User Principal Name.title: User Principal Name
User Principal Name.name: id
User Principal Name.tooltip: If you choose User Principal Name, then in the User Principal Name field, you must specify the principal name of the user whose details you want to retrieve from Azure Active Directory.
User Principal Name.description: Specify the principal name associated with the user account whose password is to be reset on Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Password
parameters.name: password
parameters.tooltip: Temporary password that you want to set for the user whose password you want to rest on Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Specify a temporary password that you want to set for the user on Azure Active Directory.

parameters.title: Force Change Password Next Login
parameters.name: force_change
parameters.tooltip: If you select this option, i.e., set it to true, then the user is forced to change his password when the user next logs into Azure Active Directory.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to true, to force the users to change their password when they next log on to Azure Active Directory.

operations.description: Make a generic MS Graph API Call by specifying the endpoint, http method, params etc.
operations.title: Generic REST API Call

parameters.title: API Endpoint
parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Specify the MS Graph API Endpoint from which you want to fetch details.
parameters.tooltip: MS Graph API Endpoint exp: /users/user@domain.com/ownedDevices

parameters.title: HTTP method
parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Specify the HTTP Method used to access the endpoint.

parameters.title: Query params
parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Specify the query params in JSON format to send as part of the url
parameters.tooltip: Specify the query params in JSON format to send as part of the url

parameters.title: Request Payload
parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Specify the Body of the POST/PUT/PATCH request in JSON
parameters.tooltip: The Body of the POST/PUT/PATCH... request in JSON, exp: {"officeLocation": "18/2111"}
